project_name: Lotus, Builtin Actors, and ref-FVM - Core Filecoin Protocol Implementations
filecoin_growth_impact:
Lotus, Builtin Actors, and ref-FVM form the foundation for every on-chain transaction and smart-contract execution on the Filecoin network.

All FIL-denominated activity - including storage and retrieval deals, DataCap allocations, verified client onboarding, and miner operations - depends on the actor logic implemented and maintained by FilOz.

By delivering stable network upgrades and ensuring deterministic execution across clients, these implementations safeguard billions of FIL in value transfer and collateral, supporting an active and reliable storage economy.
description: Throughout the RetroPGF Round 3 evaluation period, the FilOz team maintained and advanced Lotus, Builtin Actors, and ref-FVM - the core implementations that power the Filecoin network. These updates improved sync performance, reduced resource usage, streamlined network upgrades (NV25–NV27), and enhanced on-chain actor logic and FVM spec alignment through [FIP-0105](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0105.md), [FIP-0106](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0106.md), and [FIP-0109](https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0109.md). Together, these implementations form the foundation of Filecoin node operations, ensuring network reliability, execution consistency, and ongoing protocol innovation.
additional_impact:
The FilOz team’s work on Lotus, Builtin Actors, and ref-FVM extends beyond software maintenance.

These repositories anchor cross-client collaboration through the Implementers Working Group, provide spec alignment and testing infrastructure for new protocol features, and ensure that network upgrades reach mainnet safely.

They also enable rapid debugging and incident response across the Filecoin ecosystem, strengthening resilience and developer confidence in the network’s core architecture.
end_user:
The primary beneficiary is the Filecoin network itself, which depends on Lotus, Builtin Actors, and ref-FVM as the foundational implementations that make the protocol function.

These components define the rules, logic, and execution environment that enable every Filecoin transaction and upgrade.

They are also relied on by most infrastructure and tooling providers, including RPC services and developer platforms, for stable access to the network.

Through this work, FilOz ensures the reliability and continuity of the entire Filecoin ecosystem.
testimonials:
FilOz received consistent positive feedback from developers and ecosystem partners during NV25–NV27 upgrade coordination. Teams from Forest, Venus, and several Storage Providers noted the clarity of documentation, responsiveness to issues, and stability of network upgrades in Implementers WG calls, Slack discussions, and GitHub threads.

This feedback was informal but sustained across multiple channels, reflecting strong trust and appreciation from other Filecoin implementation teams and operators.

Further reflections on FilOz’s engineering work and upgrade stewardship can be found on our [Medium page](https://medium.com/@filoz).
top_five_dependents:
- **Curio - Integrated F3-Aware PDP and Retrieval Services**  
  Built on Lotus APIs and Builtin Actors to run verifiable storage and retrieval services using F3 finality and on-chain verification.

- **Boost - Deal Orchestration and Retrieval Indexing Updates**  
  Depended on Lotus RPC and market actors to handle deal settlement, retrieval verification, and performance improvements introduced in NV26-NV27.

- **Venus - Spec Alignment Through Builtin Actors and ref-FVM v17**  
  Adopted updates to actor logic and execution behavior to maintain compatibility with the latest Lotus and FVM releases.

- **Forest - Cross-Client Validation of Actor and F3 Behavior**  
  Used ref-FVM and Builtin Actors test harnesses to validate deterministic execution and ensure mainnet interoperability.

- **Filecoin Onboarding Ramps - On-Chain Verification and Client Registration**  
  Relied on Lotus and Builtin Actors for client onboarding, deal publishing, and actor-level verification logic during data onboarding tests.
filecoin_users_percentage_using_project:
All Filecoin clients depend on the ref-FVM and Builtin Actors maintained by FilOz, which together underpin the execution layer of the entire network.

Over 90% of identifiable Filecoin nodes run on Lotus-based clients, demonstrating its central role in network stability and operations across mainnet and test networks.

These components form the shared foundation that enables every transaction, upgrade, and on-chain service across the Filecoin ecosystem.
